class_notes:
(Same as HIST 239 1)
(This course will cover the contours of African American  history since Reconstruction. Emphasized in this course will be the various forces which have converged to shape the lives of African Americans in the 20th and 21st centuries. Focal points include Jim Crow and the Black Nadir, the Great Migration, the New Negro Movement, the Civil Rights and Black Power Movements, the Conservative backlash of the 1980s and 1990s, and the rise, legacy, and aftermath of President Barack Obama. As often as possible, music and other audio clips, video documentaries and films, and visual art will be utilized to provide additional insights.)
course_description: Examines African American history from 1865 to the present. Emphasizes regional, gender, and class distinction within African American communities, and the ways in which industrial transformations shaped African American life, thought, and resistance.
